meanings.definition: To make a signal or signals.
meanings.sent1: She signalizes to her friend across the room with a wave.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse signalizes ships to warn them of danger.
meanings.sent3: The cat signalizes its hunger by meowing loudly at dinnertime.
meanings.sent4: The bright red color of the stop sign signalizes the need to halt.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock signalizes the start of a new day with its loud ringing.

meanings.definition: To be a sign or indication of; betoken; evidence; show.
meanings.sent1: His tired expression signalizes that he needs a break.
meanings.sent2: Dark clouds signalize an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The sudden silence in the room signalizes that something strange is happening.
meanings.sent4: The closed sign on the door signalizes the end of business hours.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face signalizes her happiness and contentment.
